We weren’t surprised that George Pelecanos has a short Bucket List; after all, he is an award-winning author as well as a producer for The Wire. With 19 books under his belt, multiple producing credits and non-stop offers, it’s no wonder the list is short.

The Embassy of Sweden has started a year-long journey through Earth & Space. Within their outreach program they will explore:

Outer Space – how can innovations in space become sustainable solutions on earth? What can we learn from space science?

Secrets

Ron Kessler is concerned about the recent Secret Service debacle and he should know whether or not to be concerned. He is the author of 20 non-fiction books about the US Secret Service, FBI and CIA. Seven of his books have appeared on the New York Times Best Seller list.

An Hour Outside of DC

An hour outside of DC, there is this magical place called Salamander Resort & Spa. Per founder Sheila Johnson’s guidance, this resort feels like her home. An amazing home where everything is perfect – and still feels cozy and homey.

Going Home For An American Leader: Sen. Edward W. Brooke

A memorial service will be held for former Senator Edward W. Brooke on Tuesday, March 10, at the Washington National Cathedral. The service will begin at 11 am.

Oops- She’s 'Dunnit' Again!

Georgetown resident and former NPR Correspondent Mary Louise Kelly can now add “Favorite Local Crime Writer” to her resume with the release of her second novel “The Bullet” dropping March 17th.

Bistrot Lepic Celebrates 20 Years in Georgetown

Celebrating 20 years as Georgetown’s favorite Parisian bistrot, Bistrot Lepic is offering its guests a very special menu available for 20 consecutive days, from Monday, March 9th until Sunday, March 29.

West End Cinema Closing

Josh Levin, owner of the West End Cinema announced that the independent art house will be closing at the end of March. This three-auditorium neighborhood theater was popular for showing small, independent films.

By Brady HoltCurrent Staff Writer

A pair of informal development proposals hint at the possible future of Georgetown’s Fillmore School property, a 1.2-acre site at 1801 35th St. that’s currently listed for $14 million.

HM King Juan Carlos

President Obama Congratulates Georgetown University

The President Obama paid tribute Sunday to Georgetown University’s 200th anniversary of its charter with a message lauding the impact Georgetown graduates have made in this country and around the world.
Tony Bennett & Lady Gaga to Perform at The Kennedy Center

Many Rivers to Cross

Dr. Henry Louis Gates, Jr. remembers his childhood as being one of warmth. “I was surrounded by a sea of love,” he told Hollywood on the Potomac, but you probably already knew that. What you probably didn’t know is that his favorite childhood toy was Zippy the Monkey.
